p: In the recent past (ie, 1986–2005), the risks of in-shade heat exposure were moderate to high during the warmest part of the day across many tropical and subtropical regions ( figure 1). A sensitivity analysis indicated that, in subtropical regions, full-sun conditions could cause a further increase in WBGT of more than 3°C by 2090–99, compared with in-shade exposure ( appendix). As such, the following results are likely to be conservative compared with the risks of heat stress in full-sun conditions.
